result.execSummary:
The defendant Vandarious M Hampton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges by 9-30-16 or, if not paid, serve 5 days in the House of Correction.
Concurrent with: to any other sentence. No Huber privileges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vandarious M Hampton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
F&C Commitment issued for failure to pay as ordered.
5 days HOC.
DUE & OWING.

Defendant Vandarious M Hampton in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Vandarious M Hampton in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, concurrent  to any other sentence with credit for 63 days time served.  No Huber privileges . 

Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees  and surcharges by 9-30-16 or, if not paid, serve 5 days in the House of Correction. 

NOTE:  Court directs the Clerk of Courts Office to notify the Department of Motor Vehicles that  ZERO DAYS (0 days) REVOCATION should be imposed in this case.  

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Vandarious M Hampton not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 03-31-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Vandarious M Hampton in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 47. lr  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 03-03-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Vandarious M Hampton in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  
Defendant Vandarious M Hampton in custody.  
Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
